channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Scenario Planning, Foresight, and the Power of Imagination: Navigating an Uncertain Future
item.description: By fostering resilience through the consideration of various outcomes, investment practitioners can better anticipate and manage the complexities and disruptions that characterize today's dynamic environment.

item.title: OpenAI is suffering an exodus of senior talent
item.description: The newest departures leave OpenAI with only three of its 11 original cofounders.

item.title: Private Equity: In Essence, Plunder?
item.description: To understand what private equity is at its worst is a call to action, personally and professionally.

item.title: 5 ways a Harris-Walz win could reshape U.S. health care
item.description: Big changes could be coming, according to policy experts.

item.title: Small Caps, Large Caps, and Interest Rates
item.description: The relationship between stocks and interest rates is not reliably stable. There are periods when equities are highly rate sensitive, and periods when they aren't.

item.title: An interest rate cut won’t fix the housing crisis, Moody’s economist says
item.description: Rate cuts will help, but there’s still a shortfall of close to 2 million homes in the country, according to Moody’s.

item.title: How Well Does the Market Predict Volatility?
item.description: How accurate is VIX on a realized basis and when does it diverge with the market?

item.title: In Tim Walz, Kamala Harris gets a labor champion who can still appeal to critical heartland voters
item.description: The Minnesota governor has passed sweeping labor reform laws in his second term, earning the endorsements of UAW President Shawn Fein and Senator Bernie Sanders.

item.title: What Do Experts Really Know? Embracing the Unknown
item.description: Confidence is a necessary but insufficient factor in long-term investing success. Raising the metaknowledge quotient of the investment team can help protect against the surprises that lurk in left-tail events and remain unknown, until they’re known.

item.title: How an obscure Japanese yen trade sparked a global market meltdown—and why the worst could be yet to come
item.description: Financial experts explain the Japanese yen carry trade, a Wall Street favorite that’s beginning to unwind.
